name: Special Topics in Language Change
description: This course examines current issues of theoretical and/or empirical relevance in linguistics with special reference to phenomena involving language change. Depending on the instructor, the focus of the course may be more oriented towards phonology, morpho-syntax, semantics, or the lexicon. [24L]
prerequisites: LIN231H5/LIN232H5/LIN237H5 (or LIN247H5), and LIN256H5//LIN288H5 (or LIN258H5), plus 0.5 credit in a 300-level LIN course.
